meta.title: The B2B Social Media Book: Become a Marketing Superstar by Generating Leads with Blogging, LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Email, and More
meta.author: Kipp Bodnar and Jeffrey L. Cohen

parts.title: Introduction to Effective B2B Marketing through Social Media
parts.body: The authors, Kipp Bodnar and Jeffrey L. Cohen, introduce their book on how social media can revolutionize B2B marketing. They position social media as a transformative tool for generating leads rather than mere theory, with strategies and frameworks that enable marketers to integrate these tools effectively. They argue that B2B marketing is relationship-based, involving building long-term relationships rather than one-off transactions like B2C. The book aims to demystify social media's potential for B2B and move beyond tools to how they can be harnessed to drive business goals, promising tangible return on investment (ROI).

parts.title: Core Elements of B2B Social Media Lead Generation
parts.body: The basic components of lead generation in B2B social media include offers, calls to action (CTAs), and landing pages. Offers can be educational webinars, ebooks, or consultations that entice prospects to exchange their contact info. Landing pages, crucial for lead conversion, should be clear and free from distractions to maximize conversion. Simplicity is key; forms should ask for minimal necessary info, as too many fields can deter leads. Effective landing pages have a high conversion rate, influenced by the quality of the offer and the reduction of site navigation to focus prospects on filling out the form. Creating effective offers requires thinking like an artist; offers should solve problems for the prospect, align with your business, and provide unique information. B2B marketers must act like publishers, focusing on who clicks CTAs and ensuring content context aligns with prospects' interests. Context is more important than content, as content tailored to customer needs drives them further down the buying cycle. Social media extends reach; tools like Facebook and Twitter facilitate discovery, critical for attracting new leads to your business content.

parts.title: The Power of Ebooks in Lead Generation
parts.body: Ebooks are a powerful top-of-the-funnel (TOFU) offer in lead generation. They provide valuable content that addresses broad industry problems, helping to attract potential customers. For example, a company might create an ebook titled "10 Best Practices for Improving Hospital Facilities Management" to attract hospital administrators. These offers position your brand as an industry expert and help gather leads by asking for personal information in exchange. Creating MOFU offers, which focus on moving buyers further along the sales journey, is also crucial. These can include consultations or product demonstrations that revolve around specific products or services, like offering a 30-minute phone consultation to uncover cost-saving opportunities. Combining both TOFU and MOFU offers is essential for moving prospects through a complex B2B sales process. Content-rich TOFU offers, like ebooks, serve as entry points into your marketing funnel, capturing interest and establishing credibility without pushing for an immediate sale. By providing useful insights, these offers help in building trust and nurturing relationships with potential clients.

parts.title: Ebooks, Webinars, & Video Content in Lead Generation
parts.body: Ebooks, webinars, and video content have emerged as powerful tools in lead generation, particularly due to their appeal in the digital age. Creating informative, engaging content is crucial. Whether opting for ebooks that graze the surface or webinars that dive deeper into topics, the key is to maintain a balance of information and entertainment. Webinars, being cost-effective and widely accessible, serve as an alternative to traditional trade shows, offering a more personal engagement with target audiences. Each piece of digital content, including videos, should aim to inform and entertain, fitting the infotainment model to capture and keep attention amidst many distractions. Videos should be concise (under 3 minutes) to cater to short attention spans, focusing on storytelling to engage viewers. This concept applies to any B2B marketing strategy. Content audits offer insights into existing materials that can be reimagined for ebooks or webinars, while video storytelling must be visually engaging and aligned with corporate messaging. This strategy is enhanced in the digital world by making use of platforms like YouTube for broader reach, leveraging its search optimization potential.

parts.title: Track, Comment, and Optimize for Lead Generation
parts.body: Adopting a blog strategy should include tracking link clicks with a URL shortener to compare against blog arrivals, revealing ideal posting times. Interacting in industry-related blogs can boost awareness but add valuable insights only. Success metrics evolve from post frequency to traffic metrics and then to lead conversions. Observing which content types work best allows for tailored content optimization. Encourage guest bloggers for diversity, but ensure quality control over any promotional content. Finally, evaluating inbound lead success through key performance metrics ensures a strategy that pursues top-tier conversions.

parts.title: Direct Messages, Hashtags, and Finding B2B Leads on Twitter
parts.body:
Direct Messages

Direct messages on Twitter are private and only work if the recipient follows the sender. They’re good for exchanging contact information but avoid sharing very private info as they might pass through third-party apps and are stored on Twitter’s server.

Hashtags

Hashtags such as #smb2b help join conversations around topics. However, incorrect use like #companyname if rarely searched offers no value. Overuse and spam can also drown important tweets. Argyle Social found tweets with hashtags can get fewer clicks than those without.

parts.title: Adapting B2B Marketing for Mobile
parts.body: Mobile Phone Usage is now exceeding desktop usage for searching and social media interaction. As a B2B marketer, understanding how your content is consumed on smartphones is critical. Mobile optimization of websites and emails ensures a good experience for users on-the-go, who are prone to distractions. Smartphone operating systems like iOS and Android have overtaken BlackBerry. Proper mobile site optimization improves both user experience and search engine visibility. Use mobile-specific style sheets (CSS) to adapt your content for small screens. As mobile devices become central to accessing info, integrating location-based services may offer opportunities, especially for sales teams. Additionally, consider testing your email and social media campaigns using data-driven insights to enhance lead generation success on mobile. Transitioning to mobile-focused strategies, from landing pages to marketing emails, demands understanding platform-specific behaviors. Prioritize visual clarity and engagement within limited space to capture distracted audiences.

parts.title: Achieving Marketing Success in the Digital Era
parts.body:
#

Achieving Marketing Success in the Digital Era

In today's world, network-based social connections and being active on social platforms can extend a company's reach dramatically. However, many B2B organizations block access to social sites, limiting the efficiency and reach of their employees. If faced with this, identify those responsible for the decision, and address their concerns with examples and benefits. Highlight that using social sites can actually improve productivity and generate leads, rather than being a waste of time. Marketers must also face executives who may lack understanding of social media's business value. Overcome this by demonstrating ROI using concrete data, like customer acquisition costs and revenue metrics. Furthermore, even if customers or industry partners aren't currently using social media, use social tools and tactics to still create valuable engagement with your target audience – even if not through typical social networks.

parts.title: B2B Social Media Resources and Community Support
parts.body: Kipp Bodnar and Jeffrey Cohen encourage readers to dive deeper into their B2B social media strategy by downloading the B2B Social Media Workbook at B2BWorkbook.com. This comprehensive 50-page guide offers easy-to-follow step-by-step instructions to transform your B2B website into a lead generator, supported by thorough checklists and a B2B content decision map. They urge readers to implement these strategies immediately and not just perceive them as mere ideas. Furthermore, aspiring B2B marketers can join the B2B Superstars community at B2BSuperstars.com, crafted for collaboration and learning. The community, organized by Kipp and Jeff, provides members with exclusive bonus content, access to special webinars, and real-time support through video Q&A sessions. The encouragement is to become a marketing standout and not settle for the ordinary.
